sentences.en: Archer crumpled up the yellow sheet as if the gesture could annihilate the news it contained.
sentences.cn: 阿切尔把这张黄纸揉皱,好象用这个动作就会抹掉里面的消息似的.

sentences.en: For wait for flying with your ash to annihilate of heavy meet.
sentences.cn: 只为等待与你灰飞湮灭的重逢.

sentences.en: Herd the enemy troops together and annihilate them.
I will annihilate every last blood relation of sparda.
sentences.cn: 我要消灭所有跟sparda有关的家伙.

sentences.en: Just one of these bombs could annihilate a city the size of New York.
sentences.cn: 这种炸弹只要一颗就能彻底毁灭纽约那么大的一座城市。

sentences.en: Napoleon's fleet be annihilate by nelson.
sentences.cn: 拿破仑的舰队为纳尔逊所消灭.

sentences.en: Scotland won't take Bruges and then try to annihilate HRE.
sentences.cn: 苏格兰不会占领布鲁日从而导致HRE的灭亡.

sentences.en: Sparda! I will annihilate every last blood relation of Sparda!
sentences.cn: 贝尔渥夫:那种恶臭泄漏了你的行踪,来自该死的斯巴达的味道! 我会消灭任何一缕斯巴达的血脉!

sentences.en: Such wonderful and wellestablished facts at once annihilate the theroy.
sentences.cn: 这些奇异而确定的事实即刻可以推翻这种学说.

sentences.en: The human race has enough weapons to annihilate itself.
sentences.cn: 人类有足够的武器灭绝自己。

sentences.en: The war came and almost entirely annihilate the steamboating industry during several years.
sentences.cn: 战争爆发了,几乎使航运事业完全停顿了好几年.

sentences.en: There are lots of ways of annihilating the planet.
sentences.cn: 有很多毁灭那个星球的方式。

sentences.en: They eventually annihilate with an electron that has energy associated with it.
sentences.cn: 它们最终同带一定能量的电子一起湮灭.

sentences.en: We have lost the optimal time to annihilate the enemy.
sentences.cn: 我们失去了歼灭敌人的最好时机.

sentences.en: We must herd the enemy troops together and annihilate them.
sentences.cn: 我们必须聚敌而歼灭之.

sentences.en: We should bear in mind that we have to annihilate the enemy.
sentences.cn: 我们要把歼敌的重任时刻记在心上.

sentences.en: You want to set it up so that they'll annihilate each other.
sentences.cn: 你必须利用这点使他们消灭对方.

words.tran_cn: 歼灭者；消灭者；[数] 零化子

trans.tran_en: to destroy something or someone completely

trans.tran_cn: 歼灭，毁灭，使消失，彻底击败，战胜，使无效，使废弃
trans.tran_en: to destroy something or someone completely
